microkeras.operations.backward package

Submodules

microkeras.operations.backward.backward module

microkeras.operations.backward.backward.backward(model, X, Y, loss)[source]

Perform backward propagation through the entire model.

Parameters: model (Sequential): The neural network model. X (numpy.ndarray): Input data. Y (numpy.ndarray): True labels. loss (str): Loss function used.

This function updates the gradients (dZ, dW, db) for all layers in the model.

microkeras.operations.backward.backward_layer module

microkeras.operations.backward.backward_layer.backward_layer(model, layer_index, X, Y, A_prev, loss, m)[source]

Perform backward propagation for a single layer in the model.

Parameters: model (Sequential): The neural network model. layer_index (int): Index of the current layer. X (numpy.ndarray): Input data. Y (numpy.ndarray): True labels. A_prev (numpy.ndarray): Activation from the previous layer. loss (str): Loss function used. m (int): Number of training examples.

Returns: tuple: (dZ, dW, db) gradients for the current layer.

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_db module

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_db.calculate_db(dZ, m)[source]

Calculate the gradient of the bias.

Parameters: dZ (numpy.ndarray): Gradient of the cost with respect to the linear output. m (int): Number of training examples.

Returns: numpy.ndarray: Gradient of the bias.

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_db_wrapper module

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_db_wrapper.calculate_db_wrapper(model, i, m)[source]

Wrapper function to calculate the gradient of the bias for a specific layer.

Parameters: model (Sequential): The neural network model. i (int): Index of the current layer. m (int): Number of training examples.

Returns: numpy.ndarray: Gradient of the bias for the specified layer.

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_dW module

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_dW.calculate_dW(dZ, A_prev, m)[source]

Calculate the gradient of the weights.

Parameters: dZ (numpy.ndarray): Gradient of the cost with respect to the linear output. A_prev (numpy.ndarray): Activations from the previous layer. m (int): Number of training examples.

Returns: numpy.ndarray: Gradient of the weights.

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_dW_wrapper module

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_dW_wrapper.calculate_dW_wrapper(model, i, X, m)[source]

Wrapper function to calculate the gradient of the weights for a specific layer.

Parameters: model (Sequential): The neural network model. i (int): Index of the current layer. X (numpy.ndarray): Input data (used for the first layer). m (int): Number of training examples.

Returns: numpy.ndarray: Gradient of the weights for the specified layer.

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_dZ module

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_dZ.calculate_dZ(W_next, dZ_next, Z, activation)[source]

Calculate dZ for hidden layers.

Parameters: W_next (numpy.ndarray): Weights of the next layer. dZ_next (numpy.ndarray): dZ of the next layer. Z (numpy.ndarray): Linear output of the current layer. activation (str): Activation function of the current layer.

Returns: numpy.ndarray: Gradient of Z.

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_dZ_linear_mean_squared_error module

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_dZ_linear_mean_squared_error.calculate_dZ_linear_mean_squared_error(A, Y, Z)[source]

Calculate dZ for linear activation with mean squared error loss.

Parameters: A (numpy.ndarray): Activations of the current layer. Y (numpy.ndarray): True labels. Z (numpy.ndarray): Linear output of the current layer.

Returns: numpy.ndarray: Gradient of Z.

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_dZ_relu_mean_squared_error module

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_dZ_relu_mean_squared_error.calculate_dZ_relu_mean_squared_error(A, Y, Z)[source]

Calculate dZ for ReLU activation with mean squared error loss.

Parameters: A (numpy.ndarray): Activations of the current layer. Y (numpy.ndarray): True labels. Z (numpy.ndarray): Linear output of the current layer.

Returns: numpy.ndarray: Gradient of Z.

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_dZ_softmax_categorical_crossentropy module

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_dZ_softmax_categorical_crossentropy.calculate_dZ_softmax_categorical_crossentropy(A, Y)[source]

Calculate dZ for softmax activation with categorical cross-entropy loss.

Parameters: A (numpy.ndarray): Activations of the current layer (softmax output). Y (numpy.ndarray): True labels (one-hot encoded).

Returns: numpy.ndarray: Gradient of Z.

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_dZ_wrapper module

microkeras.operations.backward.calculate_dZ_wrapper.calculate_dZ_wrapper(model, i, Y, loss)[source]

Wrapper function to calculate dZ for the supported layer and loss combinations.

Parameters: model (Sequential): The neural network model. i (int): Index of the current layer. Y (numpy.ndarray): True labels. loss (str): Loss function used.

Returns: numpy.ndarray: Gradient of Z for the specified layer.

microkeras.operations.backward.update_params module

microkeras.operations.backward.update_params.update_params(model, learning_rate)[source]

Update the parameters (weights and biases) of all layers in the model.

Parameters: model (Sequential): The neural network model. learning_rate (float): The learning rate for gradient descent.

This function applies the computed gradients to update the model’s parameters.
